channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'Can't stop. Won't stop': Documentary filmmakers face federal funding shortfall
item.description: PBS has been a home for independent documentaries for more than 50 years. But with the closure of the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, nonfiction ...

item.title: Myanmar to hold first general election since 2021 coup amid ongoing civil war
item.description: With large parts of the country under opposition control amid an ongoing civil war, analysts warn that election logistics could prove challenging.

item.title: Trump and Zelenskyy to discuss end of war. And, more troops head to D.C.
item.description: President Trump will host Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy today at the White House. And, more National Guard troops head to Washington, D.C. f...

item.title: Newsmax pays $67 million to settle defamation case linked to 2020 election coverage
item.description: The right-wing news channel Newsmax has agreed to pay $67 million to Dominion Voting Systems over its coverage of the 2020 presidential election. A tr...

item.title: Researchers discover a secret weapon that saves babies' lives. And it's not medical
item.description: To save the lives of infants and small kids in lower resource countries, there are a handful of tools: anti-malarial drugs, bed nets and vaccines. A m...

item.title: Hurricane Erin forecast to create dangerous surf, high winds along US coast
item.description: Hurricane Erin is pelting parts of the Caribbean and is forecast to create dangerous surf and rip currents along the U.S. East Coast this week.

item.title: Magicians Penn Jillette and Teller celebrate 50 years with Radio City Music Hall performance
item.description: Legendary magicians Penn Jillette and Teller mark five decades together with a milestone show at Radio City Music Hall, part of their anniversary tour...

item.title: Spain and Portugal fires kill two more as Spanish troops battle blazes
item.description: Spain has sent 500 more troops to wildfire-affected regions, bringing the total deployed to 1,900.

item.title: Zelenskyy, European leaders to meet with Trump on Ukraine at White House
item.description: President Trump is hosting Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and several European leaders at the White House on Monday. Follow live updates.

item.title: BBC witnesses West Bank attack by masked Israeli settlers
item.description: The BBC's Lucy Williamson says the incident near Nablus was "completely unprovoked".

item.title: What each side wants from Ukraine talks at White House
item.description: As world leaders dash across the Atlantic for crunch talks, what will they and the others present regard as a win?

item.title: Texas Democrats say they’re ending a two-week walkout over gerrymandered US House map plan
'The water had no mercy': Hundreds killed as floods ravage north Pakistan
item.description: BBC visited villages which were wiped out overnight by rains, flash floods and landslides.

item.title: Pennsylvania superintendent makes violins for students to cut school costs
item.description: As part of back-to-school season, a Pennsylvania superintendent is building violins in her office to save families hundreds in rental fees.

item.title: Leukemia survivors reunite at medical school and 102-year-old shines on baseball diamond
item.description: In this "Dear David" episode, David Begnaud shares the reunion of Ellie Koerner and Dawson Nailor, childhood leukemia survivors now in medical school ...

item.title: Amazon Books reveals best cookbooks of the year so far
item.description: Amazon Books editorial director Sarah Gelman shares her top cookbook picks of 2025.

item.title: US East Coast faces life-threatening waves from Hurricane Erin
item.description: The Category 4 storm threatens to bring life-threatening surf and rip currents to the US East Coast.

item.title: California Democrats’ push for redistricting faces a tight legislative deadline
